Intervention: In Cycle 1 (3 weeks), participants received only one palbociclib 125 mg/d orally for 2 weeks, followed by one week of non-treatment. In Cycle 2 and beyond (4 weeks each), participants received letrozole 2.5 mg/d continuously plus Palbociclib 125 mg/d orally for 3 weeks, followed by one week of non-treatment.
Eligibility: A positive inoperative estrogen receptor and a negative HER2 breast cancer.
For Phase 2 Part 2 - CCSD1 P16 Amplification and/or Loss as determined by the Central Laboratory.
• Sensitivity to bone marrow, liver and kidneys.
A prior or concomitant treatment for advanced breast cancer.
Other major cancers in the last 3 years.
Important cardiovascular events in the last 6 months.
Results: Number of Phase 1 participants with treatment-related adverse events (TEAEs; all causalities)

A serious adverse event (SAE) was any adverse medical event in a participant who received a study drug regardless of the possibility of a causal relationship. A serious adverse event (SAE) was an EA resulting in one of the following results or considered significant for any other reason: death; initial or prolonged hospitalization of a patient in hospital; life-threatening experience (immediate risk of dying); persistent or significant disability/incapacity; congenital anomaly.
In Cycle 2 and beyond (4 weeks each), participants received letrozole 2.5 mg/d in continuous treatment plus Palbociclib 125 mg/d orally for 3 weeks, followed by one week of treatment leave.
Unit of measure: Participants with an AR: 12
Participants with a Grade 3 or 4 EA: 11
